Macros | Typedefs | Enumerations | Functions
IPC Mailbox - Inter-Processor Communication
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module manages communication between different processors in Apollo5 devices using a mailbox system. It provides reliable message passing and synchronization mechanisms between MCU, DSP0, and DSP1 cores.

Key Features

  1. Multi-Core Communication: Message passing between MCU and DSPs.
  2. Message Queuing: Reliable message storage and retrieval.
  3. Interrupt Support: Hardware interrupt-based notification system.
  4. Synchronization: Mechanisms for coordinating between processors.
  5. Error Handling: Robust error detection and recovery.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure IPC mailbox system
  • Send messages between processors
  • Receive and process incoming messages
  • Handle interrupt-based notifications
  • Manage mailbox status and errors

Usage

  1. Initialize mailbox using initialization functions
  2. Configure message handlers and callbacks
  3. Send messages using provided APIs
  4. Process received messages in callbacks

Configuration

  • Mailbox Size: Configure message buffer sizes
  • Interrupt Settings: Set up notification mechanisms
  • Priority Levels: Configure message priorities
  • Error Handling: Set up error recovery options

◆ CHECK_MBOX_INIT_STATE

#define CHECK_MBOX_INIT_STATE ( )
Value:
do \
{ \
if (am_hal_ipc_mbox_init_state_get() == AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_INIT_STATE_NOT_READY) \
{ \
return AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_OPERATION; \
} \
} while (0)

◆ am_hal_ipc_mbox_data_flush()

uint32_t am_hal_ipc_mbox_data_flush ( uint32_t * data)

Flush mailbox data in the read FIFO.

Parameters
databuffer point of read data, set be NULL if no need to store the read data.
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or applicable IPC_MBOX errors.

◆ am_hal_ipc_mbox_handler_register()

uint32_t am_hal_ipc_mbox_handler_register ( uint32_t ui32Signal,
am_hal_ipc_mbox_handler_t pfnHandler,
void * pArg )

Register an handler for a specific mailbox signal.

Parameters
ui32SignalMailbox signal to register an handler.
pfnHandleris a function pointer for an handler for this signal
pArgis the parameter pointer needed to pass through

This routine was designed to work with am_hal_ipc_mbox_service(). This function adds the pfnHandler argument to a table of handlers so that am_hal_ipc_mbox_service() can call it in response to signal from mailbox interrupt.

Returns
Standard HAL status code.

◆ am_hal_ipc_mbox_service()

uint32_t am_hal_ipc_mbox_service ( uint32_t ui32Signal)

Relay interrupts from the main IPC mailbox to individual handlers.

Parameters
ui32Signal- mailbox signal read

This routine was designed to work with am_hal_ipc_mbox_handler_register(). Once an handler has been registered with am_hal_ipc_mbox_handler_register(), this function will call it in response to mailbox signals.

Returns
Standard HAL status code.

uint32_t * pui32Threshold )

Parameters
dir- from which channel direction

◆ am_hal_ipc_mbox_threshold_set()

uint32_t am_hal_ipc_mbox_threshold_set ( uint32_t threshold)

Set IPC mailbox DSP to MCU interrupt threshold.

Parameters
threshold- threshold to set, valid range is 1~31
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or applicable IPC_MBOX errors.
